experience_assessment: I have published in this field for several years.
review_assessment:_thoroughness_in_paper: I read the paper at least twice and used my best judgement in assessing the paper.
title: Official Blind Review #3
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I assessed the sensibility of the derivations and theory.
review:
This paper provides generalization bounds for permutation invariant neural networks where the learning problem is invariant to the permutation of input data. 

Unfortunately, the technical value of the content and its novelty is very limited since the proof reduces to a very basic argument that counts invariances (which is simply n! where n is the number of invariant dimensions) and uses a standard approach to give a generalization bound. Therefore, I don't think the results does not help us with better understanding of permutation invariant neural networks. 
There 

Unfortunately, the paper has several typos and mistakes as well. Another non-technical issue is that apparently authors have removed the ICLR format and reduced margin to fit the paper in 10 pages which is against the spirit of page limit.
